qas.question: Who defined a common External Power Supply for use with smartphones sold?

answers.text: The European Standardisation Bodies CEN, CENELEC and ETSI

qas.question: How many mobile phone manufacturers signed the EU's common EPS (MoU)?
Who was one of the original MoU signers?

context: <a0_0>The European Standardisation Bodies CEN, CENELEC and ETSI<a0_0/> (independent of the OMTP/GSMA proposal) defined a common External Power Supply (EPS) for use with smartphones sold in the EU based on micro-USB. <a1_0>14<a1_0/> of the world's largest mobile phone manufacturers signed the EU's common EPS Memorandum of Understanding (MoU). <a2_0>Apple<a2_0/>, one of the original MoU signers, makes micro-USB adapters available – as permitted in the Common EPS MoU – for its iPhones equipped with Apple's proprietary 30-pin dock connector or (later) Lightning connector.
